subNodes.conversationText: root
"I recognize you. I'm Phaedrus. And you're the witch who fought Mnesse."
"Yes. You know I didn't start it."
"I wasn't blaming you."
"What's her story?"
"It's a sad one."
"I have time," said the young witch.

"She's the youngest of five daughters. Studied hard, entered the Scholium early, graduated into a high office in the church. But then her family's home burned down, and everyone died in it except the two oldest sisters. Their money and reputation were destroyed, too. Her father, you see, had set the fire."
"Why'd he do that?"

"A sordid tale. Mnesse's mother caught him screwing the middle daughter. The shame was too much for him. He drugged the daughters living there as well as his wife and then set the fire -- in which, it's said, he calmly burned."
"That's more sordid than I imagined."
"It is, isn't it? In all the time I've known Mnesse, I've never been brave enough to bring it up with her."
[Continue.]

"Well, the aftermath of all that you could probably piece together yourself. She lost her position, became estranged from her other sisters, and started robbing people. Not hard work for a magician, so long as the magician can find a way to elude her old masters."
"Go on."

"Well, the aftermath of all that you could probably piece together yourself. She lost her position, became estranged from her other sisters, and started robbing people. Not hard work for a magician, so long as the magician can find a way to elude her old masters."
"How do you know her?"
"I've loved her my whole life."
"And does she love you?"
"No, not a whit. Never has."
"This feast that Mnesse was looking for --"

"I'll get to that. Her tricks draw too much attention in cities, so we came to these woods. I knew they had a bad reputation. Witches" -- he raised his mug -- " and so on. But before I fell in with Mnesse my trade brought me to the Bonny Joy one or two times, and the innkeep and I struck up a friendship. She was kind enough to let us set up here. Caterina's not a bad sort. A little too willing to turn a blind eye to things, you know. But she'd never let us rob her patrons."
"Everyone has their compensating virtues. But the feast, Phaedrus?"

"Mnesse went out walking alone. Someone with troubles like hers tells them to the moon sooner than she does to her friends. She came to a clearing -- where, exactly, we haven't been able to determine -- and found it full of light and food and friendly people. She stayed there until dawn."
[Continue.]

"When she came back, she raved about it. She said that the food tasted like childhood and that the wine tasted like hope and that every moment was an eternity of joy. She'd had the most wonderful conversations, she said, but she couldn't remember anyone's name or history or face. Thought she'd drunk too much. And now she's obsessed with finding it all again."
"Where is she now?"
"Still looking."
"And you're going to wait for her?"

"No, I'm not. I'm going back to the city. What can I do? It's clear she's under some kind of spell. Not her kind of magic -- your kind of magic, or something closer to your kind of magic. Maybe it's not an accident that you showed up right where she first thought the feast was. I don't know what that means. But I hope you're meant to help her, somehow. And maybe now that you know more, you can."
"An extravagant hope, Phaedrus."
"The only kind of hope worth having," he laughed.
"I will try not to break her
"What happened next?"

"Her tricks draw too much attention in cities, so we came to these cursed woods. I knew they had a bad reputation. Witches" -- he raised his mug -- " and so on. But before I fell in with Mnesse my trade brought me to the Bonny Joy one or two times, and the innkeep and I struck up a friendship. She was kind enough to let us set up here. Caterina's not a bad sort. A little too willing to turn a blind eye to things, you know. But she'd never let us rob her patrons."
"Everyone has their compensating virtues. But the feast, Phaedrus?"
"Go on."

"Well, the aftermath of all that you could probably piece together yourself. She lost her position, became estranged from her other sisters, and started robbing people. Not hard work for a magician, so long as the magician can find a way to elude her old masters."
"I'm afraid I don't have time for more sad stories."
